intro: Taeniophyllum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique growth habit, often forming dense clusters. Taeniophyllum species are typically epiphytic, meaning they grow on the surfaces of other plants without being parasitic. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of care.
